title: Is the statement below true? Or is the statement above false? - Quora

response.answer_text: These are questions, not statements. Suppose we reformulated them in the cliched form: “The following statement is true. The preceding statement is false.” Neither statement has any truth value at all. That’s because neither statement refers to any external state or condition, with which it could be compared and judged either true (if it accords with reality), or false (if it does not). Each statement refers only to a string of words that refers to nothing. A nested recursion does not give anything from which we could judge truth, let alone falsity.
